DataElement.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary nasopharyngeal carcinoma based on pathologic findings using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to pathologic T stage of the nasal part of the pharynx, lying above the level of the soft palate.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The nasal part of the pharynx, lying above the level of the soft palate.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: The part of the pharynx in the back of the throat, at and above the soft palate. The nasopharynx is continuous with the nasal passages.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/8/20 tmt added Registration Status.; 1/8/20 Received permission from Brian Campbell to transfer ownership from CTEP to NCI Standards. Changed workflow from retired to draft new with permission from CTEP to reuse with AJCC TMN stage CDEs. mc 10/3/13

ValueDomain.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of nasopharyngeal cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. Epithelial tumors of the nasopharynx are staged using this staging system. Mucosal melanoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma of soft tissue, bone, and cartilage are not included in this classification. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with intracranial extension, involvement of cranial nerves, hypopharynx, orbit, parotid gland, and/or extensive soft tissue infiltration beyond the lateral surface of the lateral pterygoid muscle. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with intracranial extension, involvement of cranial nerves, hypopharynx, orbit, parotid gland, and/or extensive soft tissue infiltration beyond the lateral surface of the lateral pterygoid muscle. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with tumor infiltrating bony structures at skull base, cervical vertebrae, pterygoid structures, and/or paranasal sinuses. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with tumor infiltrating bony structures at skull base, cervical vertebrae, pterygoid structures, and/or paranasal sinuses. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with extension to parapharyngeal space, and/or adjacent soft tissue involvement (medial pterygoid, lateral pterygoid, prevertebral muscles). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with extension to parapharyngeal space, and/or adjacent soft tissue involvement (medial pterygoid, lateral pterygoid, prevertebral muscles). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with tumor confined to the nasopharynx, or tumor extending to oropharynx and/or nasal cavity without parapharyngeal involvement. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with tumor confined to the nasopharynx, or tumor extending to oropharynx and/or nasal cavity without parapharyngeal involvement. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No tumor identified, but EBV-positive cervical node(s) involvement is present. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: No tumor identified, but EBV-positive cervical node(s) involvement is present. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
